word: Nadab and Abihu Had Formed the Habit of Drinking.-- Anything that lessens the physical power enfeebles the mind, and makes it less clear to discriminate between good and evil, between right and wrong. This principle is illustrated in the case of Nadab and Abihu. God gave them a most sacred work to perform, permitting them to come near to Himself in their appointed service; but they had a habit of drinking wine, and they entered upon the holy service in the sanctuary with confused minds. . . . "And there went out fire from the Lord, and devoured them, and they died before the Lord."--Fundamentals of Christian Education, pages 427, 428.
